TEI.2.document_title: J. B. Miller to James F. Perry, 12-10-1834

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 35

div1.p: D Sir I have taken the liberty to refer to you in relation to a school Miss Trask has just opened in Coles settlement She is from the state of New York, and well qualified in every respect, the Boarding establishment will be conducted by Mrs Hays a verry respectable old lady boarding can be got any where in the neighborhood, the situation is a pleasant and healthy one. Should any one call upon [you] for information you can with confidence say to them what I have said to you—with this young lady I am well acquainted
